alert.note: Alert for Bibb; Houston; Jones; Monroe; Twiggs (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 25 at 7:19PM EST until January 30 at 10:36AM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Georgia... Ocmulgee River near Macon affecting Monroe, Twiggs, Bibb, Jones and Houston Counties. For the Ocmulgee River Basin...including Jackson, Juliette, Griffin, Juliette, Macon, Dames Ferry, Macon, Clinchfield, Hawkinsville, Hawkinsville, Byron, Abbeville, McRae, Scotland, Lumber City...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM LATE FRIDAY NIGHT TO LATE TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Ocmulgee River near Macon. * WHEN...From late Friday night to late Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 16 feet, Bankfull conditions occur along the river upstream and downstream from the gage at U.S. Highway 80 or Martin Luther King Boulevard. Some flooding of low lying areas begins in portions of the Ocmulgee Riverwalk and agricultural lands well downstream. At 18 feet, Flood stage is reached. Minor flooding begins along the river upstream and downstream from the gage at U.S. Highway 80 or Martin Luther King Boulevard. Portions of the Ocmulgee Riverwalk and agricultural lands well downstream will be under a foot of water. At 20 feet, Minor flooding expands. An increasing amount of the Macon GreenWay Ocmulgee Heritage Trail floods north of the Martin Luther King Boulevard bridge. The flood waters will be around one foot deep on portions of the trail and both banks overflow upstream from the bridge. Large portions of agricultural lands well downstream will be under one to three feet of water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 AM EST Thursday the stage was 10.1 feet and rising. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early Saturday morning to a crest of 21.8 feet Saturday evening. It will then fall below flood stage early Tuesday morning. - Flood stage is 18 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta. The next statement will be issued Friday morning at 730 AM EST.
